yelp_reviews.author: Sharayah S.
yelp_reviews.review:
I've never rented from an actual rental company before - I've only ever rented from private parties. I am by nature opposed to big corporations, so when I was rental-shopping, I avoided homes rented by Windermere, and other places like it. But a home I really wanted to see was Windermere's, so I finally gave in and took a look. I'm soo glad I did, because it was definitely the house for me.

I have never had ANY problems or issues of ANY kind with Windermere or Ebright Wight. Doug Wight is just about the nicest guy in the world, and the best landlord I could ever have hoped to have. He is honest, he is fair, and he gets things done. Any time I have any issue or problem with my house, he sends someone right over. The girls in the office are always super nice and helpful, and I have never had any complaints whatsoever. 

Maybe I will sing a different song when I move out (if? I love it here.), but the security deposit wasn't even that high, so though I hope they don't keep it, as I've taken really excellent care of my house, if they do, they do. That's part of renting. 

If the other renter had mentioned the dirty carpets to them when he moved in, I'll bet they would have sent someone over to clean them. Even I knew to make a list of anything wrong with the house before I moved in, and I've never done this before. I'm also bothered that he listed a lot of positives about Windermere and even said it's "not the worst company to rent from," but then he gave them only 1 star? Come on. How about we rate on our experience as a whole, not penalize them for our own inability to report damage to our unit upon arrival. 

As for the repair man letting himself in without authorization, it's inexcusable. I've never had it happen to me, and nothing in the world would upset me more in the capacity of renting. But I've lived here 3.5 years, and filled out my share of work order requests, and they've always been really good about calling me ahead of time. Never once have they shown up without my authorizing it. 

I have always paid my rent on time, and taken care of my home. I can't speak for deadbeats who don't do the same. If you're a responsible person, I absolutely recommend Windermere/Ebright Wight. I am beyond blessed to live in one of their homes. I can't rave about it more.

yelp_reviews.author: James V.
yelp_reviews.review: Their agents intentionally lied to my mother about not meeting income requirements when her income more than exceeds their requirements and that the rent does not exceed 40% of her income, I will make sure people know not to rent from them for being liars

yelp_reviews.author: Liese F.
yelp_reviews.review: Let's start with the good, if you keep on them they are responsive and helpful. Everyone I have spoken with has been nice. The bad, they charged a little over $99 to replace a light bulb. So if you do rent from them make sure you account for everything when you move out so get your deposit back.

yelp_reviews.author: John T.
yelp_reviews.review: I had used this company since 2019. It's was a very bad property management company that you can not depend upon.It was tragic for me. The way they treat me and my tenants. We cannot get any respond from them when we need them. therefore they are all there for them self instead of taking care of your issue nor care for your property. My tenants has been rent my property for over two years and he fed up with it because of no reply or respond by the property manager when he needed help or some thing. He moved out of my property,sadly I got slapped with the bills of about $1000 on a touchup paint by Windemere management. I urge you not to use this company ,if you need  property management.take my words and so you will not be regret it. I thank you for reading your safety messages. That's all my concern.

yelp_reviews.author: Christian M.
yelp_reviews.review: the people who work the front desk are extremely rude and have zero customer service skills. when I send in maintainer requests they take weeks if not months to respond . my door bell catches fire when it's used and you know what they said to me " put duck tape over the button and don't use the door bell " instead of bringing someone out here to fix it . I've lived with these rent raising thieves for 8 years and I wish someone would take this company down !

yelp_reviews.author: Nicole H.
yelp_reviews.review: DO NOT RENT THROUGH WINDEMERE! My partner and I got totally scammed by them trough the application process. First, they said we each had to apply to even schedule a viewing so we paid $45 each in application fees. After paying $90, they kept telling us the property isn't available to view yet. Then they tell us because we're not married we EACH have to make 2.5x the rent for $3400 house! Or we have to find a cosigner that makes 5x the rent (so 17K/month)!! Complete discrimination because we're not married and a total waste of time and money! We still never saw the place smh.

yelp_reviews.author: Donna W.
yelp_reviews.review: I rented from a private owner (he rents several properties) beginning of 2019. June 2022, I filed a protection order against my ex. & was awarded the home. The owner attempted to evict daughter & I. I asserted my rights & the notice was rescinded. After filing a complaint w/ HUD, the owner hired Windermere to deal with the hysterical woman that I am. I was EXTREMELY hopeful as there had been harassment & retaliation from the owner. I received a letter on my door mid-August. Windermere took exactly 2 weeks to verify after numerous calls. It also said if we had paid Sept. to the owner, that was fine, which we had by this time. Also, that a walk-through inspection to be conducted & that if refused I will be charged $100.00. Personally, I try not to open with threats when I begin a relationship. At the inspection 9/6 I advised them that our refrigerator hadn't been working. When stated that its difficult eating out of a freezer, her comment was "that's good, at least your freezer is working". It did not. We were eating out of a chest freezer we had brought into the home. I assumed she wrote it down while taking notes when asking my daughter & I if there are any maintenance requests to be fixed. Nope. I had to email & voicemail, & deal with the owner & his hostile & belittling texts. Eventually after an educated repair person confirmed that it was no longer working, we received a refrigerator 10/13. As I had been a month-to-month tenant for over 3.5 years with zero rent increases promised and obliged at $1525.00 per month, Windermere decided to toss a new lease at me starting at $1600.00 effective immediately due Sept. rent that had already been paid. Included was another increase, now $1700.00 effective 1/1/2023. Then "expectations", my parents were more lenient w/ rules & regulations when I was a child. I advised I would not be signing the lease & wish to remain month to month. 1/31 I received notice with the threat of unlawful detainer if we're not gone by 4/30 as the owner intends to sell the home. I asked if the other person on the lease had been notified as his items were still on the property. I was told they do not see anyone else listed. I let them know there is a protection order in place so if they could please communicate that, I'd appreciate it. I am still waiting to hear back. Upon the overwhelming communication as to what MY responsibilities are in the move out, that is all that was heard. Windermere was notified of my departure and that my ex could gather his items and assist in the cleaning. As soon as possible they did the walk through and give me their opinion on how the place looked. I asked for a copy of the rent increase that went into effect in Sept. I STILL have yet to receive a response. After a couple of weeks, I reached out & was told everything had been removed from the house & it was in the process of being cleaned at the direction of the owner. My ex has every character trait of narcissistic personality disorder. His stuff was #1 priority in the meaning of life. Him leaving everything confirmed my suspicions. I am disappointed that it was not communicated to me. Whatever. I also was not surprised when told that he's in the process of having the protection order amended & the owner has written a new lease for him to move back into the home 4/1 at $1,600.00 a month. I think back to May of 2022 & how I was done with my relationship & done with being punished for having the wrong response or thoughts or feelings or actions, etc. I ultimately didn't care if I had to live in my car. THANK YOU, WINDERMERE,...FOR MAKING THAT DREAM COME TRUE :o) I apologize as I believe this to be the longest review written ever. Being how I have relocated; I have also lost access to my therapist. So, this will have to do for now. I wish I could say I'm extremely grateful for them reaching out and apologizing after the threats, eviction, being notified that the owner never truly intended to sell, and completely ignoring my rights as a survivor of domestic abuse. But I'm still waiting for them to get back to me.

yelp_reviews.author: K K.
yelp_reviews.review:
I've been renting for 3 years with Windermere in Bellingham. It doesn't matter if you are a perfect tenant in every way --- they just don't care about people. 

Customer service is truly the worst I've ever experienced in any sort of environment. Not only do property managers/desk attendants avoid your as well as your calls and emails, they will conveniently "forget" you scheduled appointments and be unable to reschedule. They are rude to your face, via the phone and via email. 

Maintenance requests go unanswered for years. Yes -- I said years. They do absolutely the bare minimum for their clients and its truly stomach churning. I would recommend any property management company but Windermere.

yelp_reviews.author: A S.
yelp_reviews.review:
I have quite the story to share with the public about Windermere Property Management of Bellingham. I would also highly recommend that you visit windermerewatch.com for more valuable information. 

My boyfriend and myself signed a lease with Windermere on a place located in Ferndale back in July 2017. I had already been through several other local property management companies and had bad experiences with two others in simply applying for a place and by way of misrepresentation of properties and wasting time looking at them and or applying for them just to find out they were in really bad shape unlike the photos led one to believe. I was actually under the false impression that Windermere was a reputable business. Unfortunately that was FAR from the truth. 

On July 1st we began moving our things to Ferndale, actually my boyfriend did as I was to be flying out of Sea-Tac the following morning at 7:00 am. I stayed back to pack and we left for Sea-Tac that afternoon as we had a hotel room so that I didn't have to be on the road in the middle of the night to drive there from up here. We had dinner and went to our hotel where Bruce said his throat was sore. He said it was burning. I was concerned about it as my trip the next day was to visit my Father who was in the hospital with complications from Leukemia/Chemotherapy. I was worried about myself becoming sick while I was visiting. I never did get sick but I spoke with Bruce everyday I was gone and he said he was not feeling well everyday I was spoke with him. 

I returned to Seattle a few days later and spent my first night in our new place in Ferndale. I woke up that first night several times coughing. I specifically recall wondering what was irritating my throat as it was not a cough that felt like I was becoming sick. Just an irritating, dry, unproductive cough. This was the beginning of a nightmare. I started to not feel well in all kinds of ways. My throat was burning, I felt sick to my stomach, and I kept coughing. 

The next thing that happened was the second night at our place. As it was July, it was hot out. I had several windows open trying to cool the place off. While downstairs in our bedroom I suddenly began to feel as though I was going to suffocate. I had the window in our room wide open and still I felt like I could not breathe adequately. I began talking about not being able to sleep in our room and having to get out of there and panicking. I could smell something that I would describe as pollution. It was strong. I was about ready to have my boyfriend call 911 I was so scared about suffocating. 

The next day we drove to our storage unit and as we were unloading our Haul in Ferndale our neighbor whom we shared the duplex with came outside on her front porch and lit up. Cigarette. This was surprising to me as they advertised all of there units as no smoking. Being a former smoker I did not really want to be around smokers because it has not been a year since I quit. What happened next was unreal. Our neighbor proceeded to tell me how she had to have her front porch replaced. She had set it on fire by putting a cigarette butt in a can without enough liquid in it and it started her porch on fire. The fire dept. was called and the porch was so bad it had to be replaced. So now I have rented a place next door to someone who has already started a fire. 

Within a week another neighbor in the building next door to us flicked his cigarette into the bark in front of his place and my boyfriend came home from work to find it on fire. 

As for the burning throat, suffocation fears? The property had been sprayed with Crossbow in a manner that was done without any regards for people living there. I have over 200 pictures of this massive application of known carcinogenic herbicide. Windermere let us out of our lease but did absolutely nothing to help us relocate. In fact they actually retaliated against me when after 5 weeks of daily poisoning I became impatient and emailed them letting them know I was very upset with their unresponsiveness. I documented everything daily. We got out of there after two of the worst months of my entire life. God knows what long term health impacts we may suffer. 

I can tell you all this much, Windermere did not care one bit about us and the horror we had to deal with worrying about the lady next door and the herbicide issue. BEWARE!!!!!

yelp_reviews.author: Paul L.
yelp_reviews.review: After being hustled to pay a fee and go through the  labor-intensive process of applying to rent a property in Bellingham, this company went radio silent. This was despite my credit score of 829. One can only think of the Windermere application process as a money-grab in this tight rental market. Multiple applicants vie for a single property in competition with one another while the company sits back and ignores repeated requests for completion.

yelp_reviews.author: Julian S.
yelp_reviews.review:
We lived in the same rental for 4 years, halfway through our tenancy we were switched to Windermere. They neglected all yard maintenance even though we signed an extension on our existing lease which stated they were responsible for all of it. Later when we moved out we were charged for maintenance and cleaning that once again, was stated in our lease they were responsible for.

If you are looking for a rental in Bellingham this is the last property management company you should go to, unless you like people taking advantage of you.

yelp_reviews.author: Jun I.
yelp_reviews.review:
Moved in with three adult family members. House was brand new (still getting finished when we signed the lease, couldn't move in for a week) but had mud under the stove, scuffs throughout the house, ect...

A year later (no longer on lease, but month to month) we get a notice saying that they were upping the rent by $50. The letters were sent out on the 7th, the last day in which a tenant can inform them that they intended to move without paying for the next month. We informed them on the 15th. Given when we moved in, this was our last day to inform them that we were leaving. Everything was going fine until they said we had to pay for the next month. We called them out on the date of the letters. We also informed them about how we were not allowed to move in for a week despite already paying (we received not back pay for this week either). We also consulted a lawyer on this, who said they were in the wrong.

A few weeks passed, we moved into another place, everything seemed fine. That is, until they sent us an email saying we owed them $500!! They were charging us for the following month's rent, professional carpet, and house cleaning. The house was completely spotless when we returned it, there were no holes in the walls, and there was nothing in the lease about professional house cleaning, only carpet. That place probably looked better than when we moved in.

We should have sued them. Never, NEVER again!! Beware because if all of the Windermere offices are as shady as these guys, you'll get worked over BIG TIME.

yelp_reviews.author: Nicole M.
yelp_reviews.review: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little worried. I didn't know what to expect and went in with low expectations because we really wanted the home to rent. However, We have been very pleased as a new tenant. Tonya has been quick to reply to our emails and listen to us. I sent a few issues to her and two days later, someone was at the house fixing the issues. I'm very pleasantly surprised and happy with their service.

yelp_reviews.author: Lou J.
yelp_reviews.review: As owners of a unit that is rented out, we have not received essential reports for several months.  This company introduced a "Portal" system last year which is totally useless.  It provides irrelevant items and skips thing which, for example, we need for the IRS, not to mention for our information.  It is also difficult to contact people in the organization who might help. We note that we are not the only reviews who assigned one star.

yelp_reviews.author: Kristen E.
yelp_reviews.review:
Windermere was the Property Managment company for The Avalon Apartments while I lived there from 2014-2015.  I decided I had to finally share my story, because I came across another review that said something that helped me to connect the dots with what happened to me there.  What was said is that the maintenance is there constantly to spy on tenants and is, in fact, the owners of the property.  You'll see why this piece of information is important...
While I was there, I saw the "Maitenance"(man and woman) on site nearly every single day.  At the time I actually didn't mind it.  It is in old building, and I figured that they were renovation it one unit at a time.  It also gave me a false sense of safety.  I felt that I had a good rapport with them, and talked to them on many occasions.  I got the sense that they liked me, as I was a quiet, working professional that didn't ever have parties.  One time I had a work order for a plumbing issue, and they had even commented on how clean the place was, and how they liked how I decorated the apartment. When my lease was up I gave proper notice that I would be moving out, as I was moving across the country for my job.  I had paid over 900 in total for my damage deposit, and wanted to be sure I did everything I could to get it back.  I specifically asked "Maitenance" what I could do to insure that would happen.  The floors there are the original wood that they paint brown.  I had a very heavy table that had chipped some of the paint on the floor, and asked them if they would like me to repaint the area.  They told me not to worry about it as they already have the perfect matching color, and that I wouldn't be charged for small chips.  Other than that I left the apartment spotless, and in better condition than I found it.  Now comes the part when I got royally screwed: When I went to get my deposit back from Windermere Property Managment, it was for only about 100 dollars.  I was shown a series of pictures that were either old photos, or staged.  For example: there was a picture of the stove top(that I had left spotless) with crumbs and a long black hair on it. (I was blonde at the time). They used the chipped floor, which I was told not to worry about, to charge me hundreds of dollars to repaint the entire apartment.  I could have done the same job myself for 25 dollars had they not been deceptive about it.  There was also a very old rust spot on top of the refrigerator that I did not include on my move-in sheet, because I did not see it, and it's typically not a place people look.  Even the woman at Windermere told me that she could tell that it was there for much longer than I had lived there, and would "work on getting my money back for that."  I never saw any of that money, or heard from her again.  I contemplated taking them to small claims court, but since I moved so far away it was more trouble than it was worth.  These "Owners/Maitenance" are obviously taking advantage of their tenants, and double dipping.  Shame on them, and shame on Windermere Property Managment for allowing them to do it.  Future renters beware!  If you do decide to rent from them anyway, just be sure to take photos and video of everything before you leave so that you have proof of how you left it.  Lesson learned on my part.

yelp_reviews.author: Herb L.
yelp_reviews.review: Just awful. So dissatisfied with the property I'm currently at. They are the worst property management company I've yet to come across. Even chuckanut, SonRise, sterling, and prime property management are far better than this company. They will so everything they can to take as much money from you as possible and with little to no regard to morals.

yelp_reviews.author: Stephanie P.
yelp_reviews.review: Worst company ever. Not only do they suck at taking money from our account on time to pay our due fees, they then charge us a fee for being "late". Can't wait to move out of this hell hole they manage. If you plan on moving to the Darby estates don't. Nice area but this company Makes living here hell.

yelp_reviews.author: Marian S.
yelp_reviews.review: I would give zero stars if possible.  It seems that there is a lack of concern for customers.  I called from out of town and was given different information over the phone than I was given at the office when we showed up there.  If you are trying to find a rental in Whatcom County I would not recommend this agency.  Multiple phone calls were not returned and office staff seemed unaware of what was actually going on.  I like to give positive reviews but can not for this agency.  They would benefit from management and culture change at this agency.

yelp_reviews.author: R V.
yelp_reviews.review:
do not rent from this company .  
They are extremely rude through email and through our phone conversation.
 and basically steal an expensive rental application fee from you!

I  found this company to be discriminative against me and my partner.

Luckily we found our rental else where and are lucky to not have worked with them considering the other reviews for this company.
I spoke directly with : Michelle Jones and  Bethany Aldrich

yelp_reviews.author: Maricor S.
yelp_reviews.review: This property management is so professional and so helpful! They addressed matters on a timely manner and are very friendly. They even helped me with additional support after I was no longer their tenant. 10/10, I would definitely recommend and rent again if I ever move back to Bellingham! Thank you Tonya and the girls at the front desk office!

yelp_reviews.author: Dean O.
yelp_reviews.review: Frank at Windermere was helpful and understanding in application process. Great to work with so far, would recommend.

yelp_reviews.author: Alexander A.
yelp_reviews.review: My only experience was me walking into the office to inquire about rentals. I opened the door, said "Good Afternoon", and neither of the ladies behind the counter responded or even looked up from their computers, let alone give me a "We'll be with you in a minute." I waited a minute, started to speak, and after seeing that they were still completely ignoring me, I turned and said "Guess you don't want my business" out loud and walked out. No response. Enough said.

yelp_reviews.author: Carl W.
yelp_reviews.review: Be very careful with these folks if you are looking to rent.  We are relocating and reached out to check on properties.  You have to submit $40 per person over 18 (even husband and wife) to apply for a lease.  We checked, they said specifically that the property was still available, so we put in an application after waiting several days to get answers back regarding length of lease, etc.  After paying our $80, we find out that we didn't get the lease.  They wait until they have applications from 3 people, then they start processing the applications and award the lease to the first qualified applicant.  So apparently we were the third applicants, and never really had a chance.  I complained, their answer was essentially "sorry, not sorry".  Poor communication, taking our nonrefundable money for the application knowing that we were third...we went to another property management company that, surprise, processes each application as it comes in!!  I wouldn't give these folks any business in the future.

yelp_reviews.author: Katey S.
yelp_reviews.review: IMPOSSIBLE TO GET AHOLD OF. I was supposed to be signing a lease after paying a holding deposit, but after writing that first check I didn't get any more information. Three months later and I'm still waiting to find out when I am to sign my lease, even after calling multiple times and leaving voicemails to the property managers. There seems to be a real lack of communication in the office and absolutely no care for their customers. Too bad it's too late to find an apartment with a private company. This year long lease is going to be a real struggle.

yelp_reviews.author: Ilona B.
yelp_reviews.review:
I called them to request information about 2 bedrooms apt. for rent they advertise on their site located at 616 S. Riverview Rd. Lynden, WA. The girl checked and said it's not available, it has been rented.  Then I asked her for another one located at 2401 Elm St in Bellingham, WA and her answer was the same.  Why they still advertise places for rent if they are not available anymore is very suspicious!  Then I asked her for one more located at 2216 Mercedes Pl. in Lynden, WA.  Wow!  She checked and said yes you can apply for this one but we already have one application pending.  Furthermore, she explained if I want to apply I have to fill out  an application and pay $40.00 fee and wait for her manager to check and make a decision about approving or disapproving my application.  She said they already collected $40.00 for that place from previous applicant who is waiting for answer.  Then I requested to talk to her manager.  She connected me w/a designated broker SANDY JONES!  Wow!  What a lunatic and pure idiot is that SANDY JONES!  SANDY JONES said by law they can charge $40.00 fee for as many applicants as they wish/apply for the same unit.  Unbelievable!  This is a nice way to rip off people and make lots of money just for one unit!
Stay away as possible from Windermere Management located at 541 W Bakerview Rd in Bellingham, WA especially idiots like SANDY JONES!

yelp_reviews.author: Erika Y.
yelp_reviews.review: Desiree and Gwen never returns phone calls or emails about complaints. Takes weeks to hear back from the office, and that's only if you keep calling.

yelp_reviews.author: Spencer R.
yelp_reviews.review: I can't speak for all of Windermere, but I can speak about a woman named Tanya who was the manager of my complex and a fucking crook. Charged me $900 a month for a one bedroom apartment with no dish washer (even though there was a space in my counter for one?), a communal clothes washer for the entire complex and a 100 year old oven that set off the fire alarm whenever I used it. Of course I called her about the oven and instead of fixing it or replacing it she said to move the fire alarm which I'm pretty sure is illegal for her to suggest. Of course when I got my security deposit back after moving out there was a charge for them having to replace my fire alarm that she suggested I move. I called her on it and she strung me along for a week before finally telling me that the only way she could reimburse my money was to take it out of her salary and she didn't want to do that so it was a no-go. What a crock of shit.

yelp_reviews.author: Zac B.
yelp_reviews.review: Windermere property management wow! I won't say names but the property manager could care less about me or the property. She ignores emails and maintenance concerns, it took 4 weeks to get my ceiling fan fixed, last time I checked it was supposed to be done within 10 days. There is black mold that she is ignoring throughout the building, not to mention other  problems. I hope this company can get there sh.. together and maybe upper management will get rid of the property manager!

yelp_reviews.author: Lauren B.
yelp_reviews.review: I have had several problems with Windermere. When we moved in, the toilet seat was older than Yhe invention of the first toilet. It was worse than a portapottie seat and could not be cleaned properly it was so old. I asked for a new one repeatedly and finally my crabby husband got them to do something about it. I don't want to know how. They don't return calls or emails. Also a few months ago I changed my online payment method from auto pay to a one time bank draft. I have never missed a payment and the money was drafted from my bank account on time. Nevertheless I came home to an eviction notice on the 15th stating I had not paid. I had to verify my payment for them and they finally figured out that it was a "glitch in the accounting program." They didn't even apologize. I read somewhere that it's the law for carpets to be cleaned between tenants, and that's why there is Always a cleaning fee no matter how clean you leave it. I guarantee no vacuum clean ever touched the carpet much less a carpet shampooer. I did it myself once I identified the smell coming from the carpet upstairs as being pet related. Pets aren't even allowed. One of the garage remotes didn't work when we moved in which was fine since we didn't need it. I listed it in the form when we moved in as needing to be fixed, and 10 months later I came home to a note on the door stating that they would be entering the apartment- again- for repairs/maintenance. I left the remote out-- again- and behold it works now. The actual property itself is nice enough, but I've been in other Windermere properties that were downright nasty. It just depends on how well previous tenants kept things. I could keep going... but I don't have all day.

yelp_reviews.author: Julie M.
yelp_reviews.review: 6 phone calls/5 emails/several messages over the course of a week with requests to view some of their properties. No return calls to set up property visits. If I were a property owner, I would never list with them - they won't even take the time to schedule a property visit!!

yelp_reviews.author: Kevin V.
yelp_reviews.review:
Give Windermere a chance, but you may need to be persistent, more then I had time for.

I am a landlord.  I have not used Windermere, but I did make an effort too.  I phoned and was asked for some basic information [about the house] that was left for Sandy.  I didn't receive a call back.  I set rent at a very fair price, and have a nice home I may well retire to.  My last tenant was in the house 6 years, so I decided what the heck, I'd continue managing the property myself.  Ironically, I had mentioned to the receptionist that there was a yelp review noting their office hadn't returned a call, thinking it would ensure a prompt call back - it apparently had the opposite effect for me.

Wood floor refinishers are booked out a month, but they called back, and did so right away.  I'm a little surprised Windermere didn't take a similar interest to ensure a good sale lead didn't slip by.

yelp_reviews.author: Sandy F.
yelp_reviews.review: We own a rental home in Bellingham and called Windermere to inquire about their property management services.  I left messages for Sandy Jones who handles this, and she never once returned my call.  Is this how you run a business?  Good luck with that. I would give them zero stars if I could.

yelp_reviews.author: Paul H.
yelp_reviews.review: I rented from Windermere in September of 2009 until September of 2012. When I moved in, the carpets were pretty dirty but I let it go. It was really not a bad experience overall, I enjoyed my apartment and they were friendly enough in the office. The only real problems I had were one time, without any legal notice, a repair man entered my apartment while I was sleeping. Also when I moved out, they charged me 74 dollars (tax, parts, and labor) to replace the thermostat knob on a heater in the bedroom, and 60 dollars to clean the apartment when I had somebody professionally clean it before, and 80 dollars to clean the dirty carpet. I was able to get back 30 dollars of the cleaning fee, so Windermere was fair in that sense. I wouldn't say they are the worst company to rent from but you just need to REALLY make sure that you take pictures when you move in and pictures when you move out.

yelp_reviews.author: M K.
yelp_reviews.review: Wish I had done better research before renting but this was my first apartment. Unfortunately I'm learning a lot about what to avoid. Sandy Jones is my property manager and I wish I had a good experience with her but unfortunately not. This company charges for every little thing, it's ridiculous. Was charged a full year and a half after a repair was made in my kitchen and told that they would have it covered since it wasn't tenant caused. When I asked for paperwork showing why I was being charged later they had written "tenant caused" only like that was enough. When I emailed Sandy about my confusion she threatened to raise my rent and blamed me for the repair. I fully expect to get reamed when I move out simply because I made the mistake of choosing Windermere. I don't expect to get any of my safety deposit back, in fact it wouldn't surprise me  if I suddenly "owed" them more. These people are shady as hell and Sandy is a horrible person with no soul. She's willing to take advantage of my older neighbors as well as young adults trying to survive independently. I hope karma hits her with a bus because she honestly doesn't deserve any less. She does not care about you, your concerns, or doing her job properly (even things such as being in the office ever, seriously she arrives late, leaves early, and is always "too busy to take your call".) If you don't like money, and you love terrible property management and money hungry b**ches who will threaten you when you have legitimate concerns, Windermere is for you. There's a hundred reasons why you shouldnt choose Windermere in my opinion, but honestly just save yourself the headache.

yelp_reviews.author: Kim S.
yelp_reviews.review: To sum it up = do not do business with this company.  The property manager we are dealing with has represented the company in a highly unethical way. We will no longer do business with Windermere, having previously listed three homes through them.  For additional information, read the reviews on google plus.

yelp_reviews.author: Tammy C.
yelp_reviews.review: We rented a home from them while it was having the bathroom remodeled, I even did over a grand worth of landscaping for free while we waited. When they gave us the keys to move in, we discovered ONE FILTHY MESS! Kitchen cabinets and drawers had food in them, HUGE urine stains on the carpet, which was not even shampoo'd. Stickers on the bedroom door, they didn't even clean the tape residue that the workers left behind from the bathroom remodel! The rec-room blinds looked like cats had been climbing thru them, and were trashed. The owners were continually driving by looking in on us. Windemere had the gall to call us the day we moved in because someone came over with a shitzu and the dog was on a leash tied to their car, UP BY THE ROAD. They said "no pets allowed. When I explained that we had no pets and that the person just dropped by for a minute, they replied, " ABSOLUTELY NO PETS ON THE PROPERTY!!! Quite hypocritical considering the huge pet stains on the carpets! We assumed they would clean the carpets and dirty walls and everything else. But they didn't do any thing. When we moved out, we washed walls and left the place cleaner than when we rented it, but they would not return our deposit. They also had the nerve to sue us for 500.00 so they could replace the blinds in the rec-room. I learned a valuable lesson about taking pictures of everything when moving in to a home! No pic's- No proof! We had to pay so that the owners could do what they should have done before we moved in. Windemere is not a place to rent from if you are a person who takes pride in their home. Please, be aware.

yelp_reviews.author: J M.
yelp_reviews.review: We used Ebright Wight for management of a condo in Fairhaven and they failed to make payments to our mortgage company on time, and failed to oversee the tenants who left the condo in horrible condition, despite the company's reported inspections. Seemed to have a "boys will be boys" approach to the destruction of our property. Would never use them again.

yelp_reviews.author: Heather T.
yelp_reviews.review: I should have read the reviews about the Bellingham office! I've had a very disappointing experience with them. Probably the worst experience I have ever had. Very slow -- they take forever to review your rental application and weeks to take care of service requests. Sometimes they are friendly, buy for the most part the front office staff are quite stand-offish. Will not use them in the future.

yelp_reviews.author: Michelle M.
yelp_reviews.review: We moved in to a VERY dirty and unkept up house: Floors were sticky, small toys were scatter throughout the house and  in the yard,  many windows had no screens, dirty dirty windows & tracks, broken washer pushed into the middle of the living room (they left it there for 1 week..before sending a repair man over to fix the 35 year old washer!), carpet was very stained and was no longer pulled tight (large carpet bubble in entrance), the outdoor shed had about 2 gallons of rodent dropping, the garage was filled with tons of spiderwebs, wolf spiders, rodent droppings & old boxes of dusty items, black mold in the back of the toilets and a freezer that didn't freeze ice. We scrubbed and cleaned the house after we moved in to make it our home. We did contact them about a variety of maintenance and repair requests (they refuse many and mostly ignored our voicemail and emails).    I STATE ALL THIS  because they charged us $1000 ( from our deposit) for cleaning and repairs when we moved out! Some of these charges were for items we had request they fix when we moved in. The house was bleached and scrubbed very well when we moved out. They took money for: Unclean heating ducts ( what?), dirt in the window tacks and cobwebs, dirty carpet, a dusty ledge, plus odd repairs ( water stains under kitchen sink -which is the original 1970 cabinet bottom,  track door repair ( that was rarely used & again from the 70's, plus very cheaply made). Bellingham rental properties are scarce...so they have the upper hand.  Get your agent to do a move in walk through with you...I suggest taking a detailed video with your agent in it, stating the date.  We took pictures when we moved in, but they didn't care at the end of our lease. We ended up getting a little bit more money back after TWO months of aggressive and persistent pursuit.  What can we do besides get lawyer. Disgraceful business practices. Try to avoid them!

yelp_reviews.author: Rebecca G.
yelp_reviews.review: I rented a duplex in Blaine from Windermere Management by Ebright Wight a couple of years ago. The place smelled odd when I moved in...turned out it was mold. I washed the walls continuely and still the mold would return. My neighbors had the same problems. They were getting nose bleeds. I had a baby that was born preterm and the hospital would not allow me to bring him home with mold as my baby had chronic lung disease and was on oxygen full time. I called the office and told them the situation and they said that the mold was, "Not there problem!" The only saving grace was my sister had a friend that was high up in the corporate Windermere company and she had to call this Winderemere company and explain to them that yes, indeed it is their problem. So I was able to move into a new apartment mold free. When I moved out of my new apartment a year later they were not going to give my deposit back after I spent 3 days detailing the apartment. I used to be an apartment cleaner for a major Seattle apartment management company and was trained by Bellingham Housing Authority in turning over apartments. So I know how to clean an apartment and do it well. When I left the apartment looked cleaner then when I moved in. I did the preceedings to take them to court but settled out of court at mediation. I got what I wanted and deserved but only after fighting for it. They only care about money and good luck getting your deposit back. I was a great renter who paid my rent not only on time but a month in advance. From my personal experience,beware of this management company.

google_reviews.author: Mera ore golovach-Sushch
google_reviews.review:
I am writing to express my deep dissatisfaction with the services provided by Windermere Property Management, specifically regarding the behavior of my property manager Madison Stark And her assistant cori. Unfortunately, my experience has been marred by instances of verbal abuse, which is completely unacceptable and unprofessional.

From the outset, the property manager has exhibited a lack of respect and courtesy, often resorting to harsh and demeaning language. This behavior has created a hostile living environment and has significantly impacted my peace of mind. Despite my attempts to address these issues directly with the property manager, the situation has not improved.

I believe that all tenants deserve to be treated with dignity and respect. It is the responsibility of the property management company to ensure that their staff maintain a professional demeanor at all times. Regrettably, Windermere Property Management has failed in this regard.

I hope that this review will prompt the company to take immediate and appropriate action to address this serious issue. Tenants should not have to endure verbal abuse from those entrusted with managing their living spaces.

Specializing in victim advocacy

google_reviews.author: Lucas Richardson
google_reviews.review: Cody is the frickin man! He was super nice and respectful and did some amazing work patching our ceiling when we had a leak! He was great with communicating and coordinating follow up appointments as well. Hope he can help us out again if we ever have maintenance problems.

google_reviews.author: Troy Yerman
google_reviews.review: It's no surprise that the most frequent review is a 1-star rating. I have been a tenant of Windermere for 5 years and it's been one of the most unpleasant renting experiences in terms of the interactions with staff and the fact they don't return calls. The customer service is utterly dissatisfactory. Before we moved in, the house was not cleaned properly, carpet was dirty, walls were dirty, walls were not patched from the previous tenant, etc. They treat us as if they are letting us stay for free despite the incredibly high rent and constant increases in monthly rate. Warning to hard-working, decent people looking to find a good landlord. Being a reasonable person, I'm willing to edit my review if they show an impetus to commit to higher quality service.

google_reviews.author: Gavin Green
google_reviews.review: I have regularly worked with Windermere property Management as a vendor and have nothing but positive things to say. They are professional and courteous in all of their interactions and really try to understand what issues are going on.

google_reviews.author: Jake Werrion
google_reviews.review:
I needed a safe apartment fast after leaving a toxic domestic situation. Windermere was basically the only option at that time, and though it was more expensive than I was comfortable paying, I could afford the unit available to me. I learned that you get what you pay for.

The best and first thing that impressed me was that my apartment was incredibly well insulated, both for sound and for heat. I never heard my neighbors, and they never heard me (I checked in a few times), with my music and guitar. To be fair, I'm not SUPER loud, but I'm a pretty noisy fella, and a night owl. Apparently my HBO habit at 2:30am never bothered anyone.
I didn't need to turn my heat on very often, save for the coldest months, so my monthly power never really broke $50 at any point. A single AC unit kept me cool in august.

Second, and more importantly, they were very responsive to maintenance requests. My water heater srung a leak, and once I submitted the request, the issue was resolved same day. I got home from work and was able to take a shower first thing.

A lot of other rental companies don't have such immediate response times, and Bellingham has a lot of slumy rentals out there, but my unit with Windermere was clean, warm and cozy. Not cheap, but clean, warm and cozy. It was a great place to land and begin recovering from a big life upset.

If you make your rent, and communicate with your actual human property manager (shout out to Nicole), I expect you will have a good experience with Windermere.

google_reviews.author: Isaac White
google_reviews.review: Excellent group to work with. I am a subcontractor for Windermere and they are on top of it! Awesome communication, easy to navigate payment with and they care about their clients.

google_reviews.author: Shawn Regan
google_reviews.review: Windermere is actually a great property management business. My lease ended right when I was needing to move into my new place so they moved very fast at getting the house all fixed up. This must be a hard business to make everyone happy but I genuinely feel they do their best. Not to mention they are easy to get ahold of and are quick to respond.

owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review!

Kind Regards,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Annette Weis
google_reviews.review: My refrigerator went out during a weekend. I panicked. Maintenance man, Edgar, stopped by with a mini fridge from his shop to get me by in the meantime. Nicole, in management, ordered a brand new fridge that was delivered shortly after. Thanks everyone!

owner_response.text:
Thank you for the review! We will pass along your appreciation to Edgar and Nicole.

Kind Regards,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Wayne Lutz
google_reviews.review:
Im a rental landlord who has utilized WPM for the rental of my condominium for over a decade. Although I have been pleased with my assigned agents during this period, I recently was re-assigned to Emma Lawrence. Her support of my needs as a landlord has been exceptional.

My rental condo was nearly destroyed by a broken sprinkler line in January 2024. In the three months since then, Emma remained my rental agent through a series of challenges, which included a complete rebuild of the condo. As you can imagine, this re-build process posed many challenges to the landlord (me) and the renters. (Its a long story, but lets just say it was very complicated.)  Emma Lawrence was the key to this unusual situation. As the landlord, Im very pleased with her assistance, and Im sure the renters are also grateful to her for her handling of this unusual rental property.

owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review!

Kind Regards,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Hailey Siegel
google_reviews.review: Ive had many problems with Windermere, first being they tried denying my ESA letters but after I argued with them, they then took the letters. My first months rent was denied twice due to insufficient funds when I triple checked that I had it then they made us pay by cashiers check or bill payment check through our bank, when I came to our last month paying rent, we got charged a late fee saying our rent was late when I have tracking information on my checks mailed and saw that they cashed it during our grace period and they proceeded to tell me that my bank probably takes the the money out before it reaches them. I had them dispute the charge since they took my payments on the same day every month and never got a late fee. We had them tell us 3 times about our dog poop and they claimed to have video footage but wouldnt provide the proof and wouldnt come look at the property themselves to see that there was no dog poop. Now after moving out, we deep cleaned the place before we handed in our keys. After 21 days they came back with invoices and charges for damages that werent necessary like they charged us for a carpet clean but also charged us for new carpet? Makes so sense. And also charged us for normal wear and tear like repainting of the windowsills and handrails. I highly recommend staying away from WPM if youre a young single adult, they like to take advantage of us.

owner_response.text:
Hi Hailey,
We would appreciate the opportunity to discuss your experience with us more. You can email us at properties@rentalsbywindermere.com or give us a call at 360-733-7944.

Kind Regards,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Marie Scott
google_reviews.review:
This company does prey on disabled, low income and seniors. The manager is on a constant power trip. They pit tenants against each other during disputes and rely on the fact that people are afraid to lose their housing. They do not follow up on complaints and had come back to me, a few times, accusing me of the offense I had complained about. The manager also makes accusations without researching the issues and in turn blames the wrong person.
This review wasn't written with emotion. In fact I waited a few years before I did the review just so my emotions weren't in play. If you're low income and/or disabled you will have problems with the manager...

owner_response.text:
We apologize to see you had a negative experience. Please contact our office so that we may better address your concerns.
Thank you kindly,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Justin Soltysik
google_reviews.review: My company did some work for Windermere and I just wanted to say that Alena did a great job. She is very professional, has excellent communication, and is punctual. It was a pleasure to work with her.

owner_response.text:
We look forward to working with you again! We will share your kind review with Alena.
Kind Regards,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Hannah Clack
google_reviews.review:
This is a review solely dedicated to praising agent Liz Nunez.
If you get her on the phone if you have questions, know that she is an amazing agent/helper and she quite literally saved the day for my roommate and I. She has been the most helpful property management agent I've ever had, If you get the delight to have her assist you, be thorough and she will help you beyond words. Thank you Liz!!

owner_response.text:
Thank you Hannah for your kind words! We are lucky to have Liz on our team.

Best Regards,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Andrew Cook
google_reviews.review: I made an appointment in August with Windermere to come look at my home in Lynden that is for rent. They never bothered to show up to the appointment or call me back. Its obvious they dont care about us little people that only have one property for rent. We went with Son Rise instead and were happy we did! We will probably sell our home some day and we certainly wont be using Windermere!

owner_response.text:
Hi Andrew,
We are very sorry to hear this happened. Please email us at properties@rentalsbywindermere.com or call us at (360)733-7944 and let us know who you had spoken with. 
Thank you,
Windermere Management

google_reviews.author: Wes Reynolds
google_reviews.review: The repeated unpaid notices after they already cashed the check are quite annoying. Suggest you try someone else.

google_reviews.author: Dad tv
google_reviews.review:
Where to begin? I've been at the same residence for The last 5 years going on six Windermere has been a help up since day one. After covid times hit real hard when paydays were a miss for a year the awesome staff helped and encourage me to continue doing as I had, they helped me push through economic hardships that I was having the people at Windermere are super awesome the ladies up front Liz and Margie are my all-time favorite those ladies are beautiful in and out my heart is very large for those two I would like to personally thank both of them from the bottom of my heart they have done so much to help me and my child over the last 6 years I couldn't be more happy to be renting through Windermere Once again a big awesome shout out to Liz and Margie!!! Thanks for the years of awesomeness!!!!!.
Sincerely,
Donny P

owner_response.text: Thank you!

google_reviews.author: Brittany Fuller
google_reviews.review:
Our experience renting from Windermere was terrible, to say the least.

- Either communication between employees is completely nonexistent, or they actively ignore maintenance requests despite multiple phone calls checking in. They do not return phone calls or emails. We had a light out for two months in our apartment before they came by to replace it (the actual fixture was broken).
- We smelled sewage within a few days of moving into our brand new building (The Vantage at 418 W Bakerview). The person who fielded my weekend call told me that was not enough of a reason to send emergency maintenance. They sent someone a few days later who determined there was no issue. Only after water started pouring into the unit below did they send someone else to fix what turned out to be a massive leak behind the wall under our kitchen sink.
- The person who fixed that leak then sealed up the STILL wet area behind the cabinets until it started to smell. I can't tell you how many times I had to call the office to get them to respond to that maintenance request. My multiple requests for professional mold inspection were ignored. They looked under the sink, tested for moisture, and decided that was good enough.
- The wall heaters are installed so close to the doors in the apartment that they were melting. I put in a maintenance request expressing concern for fire hazard and even followed up with a phone call. Never heard back.

If you value your safety and health in your living space, try to rent from literally anybody else. And definitely don't choose a unit at The Vantage.

google_reviews.author: Bandhul Mishra
google_reviews.review:
I rented an apartment through Windermere last year. I was very pleased with the service they provided. They were professional, helpful, and quick to respond to any questions or concerns I had. They made the entire process of renting an apartment stress-free and efficient. The front office has an excellent staff, who took that extra effort to help me.
I highly recommend this property management company for anyone looking for a hassle-free rental experience.

owner_response.text:
Thank you for your feedback!

Kind Regards,
Windermere Management

google_reviews.author: Rye Bow
google_reviews.review: This company is the best in Whatcom County and no the 1 star is not a mistake. Judging by customer service, responsiveness, ability to facilitate adequate service, and monitoring the communication this company is a 1 star. Our HOA Board has run our HOA into financial and physical ruin. We requested an Audit of our Financials over a year ago and still have not had that executed. This is just one example of a few in which service has lacked efficiency. Washington state should be putting heavy regulation on this corrupt industry ASAP.

owner_response.text:
Thank you for your feedback. We will pass this information on to Windermere Association Management.
Kind Regards,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: lochlan roberts
google_reviews.review: Windermere has been very solid as far as rental companies go! They respond quickly to maintenance requests and reply to emails promptly! Ive personally rented through them for 6 years and never found a reason to change rental companies!

owner_response.text: Thank you, we appreciate you being a long term tenant!

google_reviews.author: Gyna Cantagallo
google_reviews.review: Using Windermere Property Management for tenant placement was an absolute dream! They handled everything from start to finish with absolute ease and kept me informed throughout the whole process. Big shoutout to Emma who was an absolute rockstar!

owner_response.text:
Thank you for choosing Windermere to assist in renting out your units! We will pass along your appreciation to Emma.

Kind Regards,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Ellie Young
google_reviews.review:
Update: since posting this review I want to add that the staff at Windermere was extremely friendly and helpful in the process of trying to find another rental property. I am not going to remove the previous review as I think it is important for people to know that they should stay on top of their application throughout the whole process. I do however want to give them credit for working with myself and my roommate and doing everything they could to keep us updated and help us find a place to live so last minute, especially Tanya, Ashley, and Frank. Although I am still frustrated about my initial experience, I definitely am very appreciative of the effort that has been put forth since.

Im usually not one to post bad reviews and try to give companies and people the benefit of the doubt but I am so upset after my experience with Windermere that I feel like I have to speak up. I am giving them 2 stars because the staff has been very pleasant and I dont think that my experience was the fault of any one person but rather a flaw somewhere in the system. My roommate and I submitted an application for one of their properties and were told when we called to ask about the property that no other applications had been submitted. They also shared that they approve or deny applications in the order that they are received. We then called back a combined total of at least 8 different times between myself and my roommate to check the status of the application and to try and get a showing scheduled to see the property. We were told it would only take a few days to process the application. After a week, I was finally able to see the property and was told by the manager that she would make sure that our application was processed as soon as she returned to the office. All of this was fine until we received a text message over a week after submitting our application that another application had been approved today and that our application had been denied. This was despite the fact that we were told our application was the first to be submitted and that we should be getting the decision days prior. I dont understand how we would be denied in favor of someone else if our application was the only one submitted at the time that we paid our fees and they claim to be first come first serve but somewhere along the way our application was not prioritized in the order we were told it would be. I am extremely frustrated and the only reason that I am considering looking into renting a different apartment with them would be to try and make up for the $65 in application fees that I have already lost and given that the application remains open for 90 days.

google_reviews.author: Dragos Pop
google_reviews.review:
I'm not one to write reviews but after reading some of the ones already posted for this Windermere branch I figured this place needed some justice so here goes my review. Tonya found us a gorgeous place in a market that is overpriced and out of control. Great experience since day one, very fast approval process. We moved in the house in less than 24 hours from seeing it. Great experience with Tonya and all the staff there too. We needed maintenance once and they were prompt to send somebody next day.

After reading some of the reviews, one really got stuck in my head so I'll share my thoughts about it. I think it is unfair to give a management company a one star review because you have pets but the owner wouldn't allow it. Find a place that allows pets and move in, or buy your own and do whatever you want with it.

We recently moved out and in less than 2 weeks we received our deposit back, and a follow up call to make sure that everything went great with the move.

Long story short, our experience was great. Tonya is awesome, the staff is awesome.

Thank you again for a great experience!

google_reviews.author: Isaac Lozier
google_reviews.review:
WORST RENTAL AGENCY I HAVE EVER HAD TO DEAL WITH. I lived under them for three years and this is not an exaggeration, the agency does not care about your health or well being, only your money. Maintenence requests go unanswered for months and months unless you call every week until they fix it. If your appliance breaks good luck getting a replacement sooner that two months. MULTIPLE times did I have to go to the laundromat for long periods of time or hand wash dishes for weeks on end.

We are getting charges over our damage deposit for things we told them to fix months and years before moving out. I am getting charged out of my deposit for a light bulb that was burnt out when I moved in. If you live in an old, rotten, outdated apartment it doesn't matter, they will still raise your rent $200 at a time. Trying to raise a family? Forget it because they failed to do anything about neighbors smoking and it coming into our apartment. Look at your new rental closely because they also paint over water damage.  Worst property management I have ever dealt with and everyone in thier office has an attitude anytime you call with a question. I guess I would be mad to if I was only making $17 an hour.

owner_response.text:
Hi Isaac,
Our system shows that you have not been a tenant with us before. Please contact our office with more details to work it this out. 
Thank you,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: J Senechal
google_reviews.review: My husband and I were co-signers on an apartment that our daughter rented in Bellingham while she attended Western Washington University.  The unit was older and  I had some concerns about her living there but it was where the girls wanted to live.  In the end I found our property managers, both Bethany and the new prop manager Tonya, to be very helpful and attentive to all of our concerns.  All repairs were done in a timely fashion and all of the issues were addressed to our satisfaction.  And when our daughter decided to live there on her own for a while,  they worked with us then! We were treated fairly and I believe that if you follow policy, read through expectations and do what is required on your end that they will do the same.  When we moved out,  we left the unit clean and in good shape and we received our deposit refund pretty quickly. We paid to clean the carpets and yet were charged for that service again - but I didnt understand that was their policy. I wouldnt let the negative comments deter you from using this agency in my opinion, they were fair and reasonable and responsive!

owner_response.text: Thank you for your review! We value our clients to have a good experience working with us, and greatly appreciate your feedback.

google_reviews.author: Dawn Day
google_reviews.review: We have rented from a few large property management companies over the past 30 years. Hands down we have had nothing but excellent service and professionalism from the staff at Windermere. We have enjoyed a few properties with this company and would recommend if you are looking to rent, this is a great management company. If you are looking use them to manage your home they are great on the up keep and inspections. Bobbi and her staff are easy to talk to and respond quickly with emergencies and concerns.

google_reviews.author: Jenny Cox
google_reviews.review: Dustin was super helpful and patient when helping my daughter move from one Windermere property to another. Thank you!

google_reviews.author: Christopher Lee
google_reviews.review: My property manager was Madison and she was available when I needed to get something fix or looked into. Neighbors being loud she was on it with notices, parking violations in assigned spots she was there contacting the residents. No place is perfect but my only problem comes from the property I was at and how the neighborhood stopped caring about keeping the area clean (shopping carts, trash, furniture) and respecting each other during quiet times from Midnight to 7am. Birchwood place Apartments is a decent place and it can be nice again once some people move out or just learn that others matter too. I had no problem with management or customer service at Windermere. They were fair and understanding on the deposit return.

owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback! We appreciate our tenants!

google_reviews.author: Hannah Johnson
google_reviews.review:
My property manager was Tonya Wiley. I am writing this review not only on behalf of Windermere, but Tonya as well. She treated me so well from the very start. When I moved back here it was so hard to find a place especially in our price range. When we found our home she helped me so much with the process of getting set up it made it so much easier on me and my family. She treated me not just well, but like family. She was always professional and she always had my back when we had a disagreement with the neighbors. She fought for me when I needed something, she was always super fast getting back to me, if I ever needed any help with anything regarding the home I am renting. Even in her spare time she would respond to me if I ever had a question or needed something. I would recommend Tonya Wiley to anybody looking for a rental in the Bellingham area she is a breath of fresh air and a ball of sunshine in the community. She always does her best to help others and she doesnt expect anything in return. I feel so lucky that I had her as my property manager for the year that I did. I know that in the future if I ever need to find Another rental or home that Tonya is who I would be contacting for any of those needs. She is not only an amazing businesswoman but she is my friend and I just wanted to share what an amazing experience I had as her client. She really helped me when I needed it the most and I will never forget that. Windermere property management is very lucky to have her. Also, the front staff at Windermere was always so kind and sweet every interaction I had with them. I never had any complaints I stand behind Windermere as a company and I stand behind Tonya Wiley as a property manager. Thank you to Windermere for all of your help and support.
Sincerely,
Hannah Johnson

google_reviews.author: McKenzie
google_reviews.review: Rented a three bedroom on Ashley Street for two years. The place itself was okay, though prone to mold and the windows did not close properly (they came with dowel rods to put in the tracks since they wouldnt lock). We filed maintenance requests on several occasions and they were almost always ignored (including that a pipe was leaking through the wall near an outlet when we turned on the outdoor spigot, and that the driveway was so covered in snow that it caused several accidents and was a safety hazard). These things were never addressed. We left the apartment in good condition, other than some damage done by a roommate that we gave the property manager a heads up about and took full responsibility for. We expected some money to be deducted from our security deposit for that damage, but when the charges came in the mail, Windermere took ALL of our deposit AND WAS ASKING FOR MORE. They deducted for things like about 8 hours of cleaning and full paint. They also charged for picking up trash that was outside of our bedroom window under our upstairs neighbors stairs, which was there when we moved in. They eventually dropped that charge after I wrote to dispute most of the charges, but we still ended up having to pay about $140 on top of losing our whole security deposit. We had moved out of state and it was not worth going to court over, which Im sure Windermere counts on. I should note that most of these issues happened under the watch of the previous property manager, and Ashley, the new property manager seemed very friendly in our correspondence about the security deposit, though Im sure she was limited on the help she could provide since she stepped in just at the end of our lease. I do not recommend renting from this company, and if you do, be sure to document everything.

owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback. Your concerns are important to us and we value our customers. Please contact our office so we can address your experience directly.

google_reviews.author: Stephanie Richstein
google_reviews.review: I have had the best rental experience with Windermere Property Management. They are always so responsive to my concerns. Appliances within the home were replaced in a timely manner. I feel confident and comfortable with them having my personal information. I love working with Sandy, our property manager, and the ladies up front are always so enjoyable! I won't deal with another rental management company, nothing will compare.

google_reviews.author: Morgan B
google_reviews.review: I've been renting with Windermere for over a year now and I really liked it to begin with. However the lack of communication about changes has driven me absolutely crazy. The rent hikes they've been putting into place have been crazy as well. My little tiny studio costs me 900 but if it weren't for me signing another year lease it would be up to 1100 by now. Yikes. Most of maintenance is sweet and property managers are sweet when you can get ahold of them.

google_reviews.author: Jw
google_reviews.review: Very weird way they go about things I shouldve read the reviews before. They indeed make you apply non refundable $45 fee to VIEW the unit before they do anything with your application, and I assume dont do a holding fee while looking over your application. I tried to ask about this and got a very confused yeah..we do the holding fee after you get accepted what? Everywhere else Ive looked, you can apply, then put down a holding fee to secure the unit while they process your application. The snickering in the background is when I decided this company isnt for me. Even if you as an employee think something is funny, you have to understand youre dealing w people who dont know how your system works from the outside. They are all different. This was so unprofessional and just added to my pile of stress in relation to renting.

owner_response.text:
Hello,
We apologize to hear that you had a negative experience. 
Please note the policy of applying before a viewing a unit was a COVID procedure done from 2020-2022 to lessen foot traffic through units for safety purposes.
The holding fee is paid after your application has been approved and you have viewed the unit to secure it. Please reach out to us with more details on this and the unprofessionalism that you experienced so that we may better assist you.

Thank you,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Abby Morgan
google_reviews.review: The staff here have been wonderful to work with. Kind, timely, and professional service has made renting from them pleasant and easy!! Ashley (our property manager) has been AMAZING. Shes available at a moments notice for questions and help with our new house. I highly recommend Windermere from a renters perspective above all other property management firms in town. They have been by far the best to work with.

owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate our tenants!

google_reviews.author: Kayli Robles
google_reviews.review: They're great.  Their customer service is super helpful, and seriously knowledgeable about the apartments they list.  I just wish they had more properties available, because I never am able to find a place through them and always end up on apartments.com, which has way more options.  I would much rather work with Windermere, because they seem like a good company.

google_reviews.author: Full Moon
google_reviews.review: I had such a bad experience with Windermere. My roommate and I found an affordable but old apartment near Western Washington University that needed a lot of repairs like; fixing the balcony doors, the window sill in one of the bedrooms wasnt fully sealed to the wall and cold air would blow through the gap when it was windy, also not all the electrical outlets worked and some went out, etc. I texted and called Tonya on multiple occasions for various issues especially the balcony doors which she had promised to fix after we moved in. Tonya specifically told us that the doors had already been ordered. I waited to hear back from Windermere about proceeding with replacing the doors and after not hearing a response I texted Tonya again and didnt hear back from her until months later. Anytime my roommate or I had an issue, Tonya from Windermere was so slow to respond which was very unprofessional. I had a lot of patience and kept putting all issues aside but Windermere was to slow to fix the problems. Also the balcony doors were never replaced and I have texts to prove they were going to be replaced from Tonya. I barely stayed a year at this place before moving on. Plus there was one night when a car caught fire in front of the apartment building and it didnt feel safe anymore. Overall the service that Windermere provided wasnt professional and they were very slow to respond and I will avoid going through any more apartments processes with them ever again.

google_reviews.author: Autumn Rifenbury
google_reviews.review: I started leasing with windermere in september this year, and have had a horrible experience with the people working for windermere. Not only am I placed on hold for 45 plus minutes anytime I show up at the office with concerns, but then I am also moved down the call waitlist even though I was supposedly next caller on the line. They do the absolute most to not get back to you. One time I was waiting for help outside the office, a man who had his move in appointment at 4 had been waiting outside for his key for an hour. By then, Windermere was an hour late to HIS move in appointment. Very disrespectful and unprofessional. I also have some mental health issues that would gladly be aided by an ESA cat, but I was told I would have to pay a $2500 deposit just for the cat. Never have I seen a cat deposit for over $400. All in all, I am trying my hardest to leave and find someone to take over my lease. DO NOT USE WINDERMERE.

google_reviews.author: Rachel Silves
google_reviews.review: I am the owner of a condo at one of the properties that they manage. We have had so many issues with Windermere, most of them involving the property manager not contacting us or responding to emails and phone calls. The icing on the cake was when we were never notified that Windermere was taking over (admittedly not Windermere's fault) however, then four months later I was doing my personal budget and we discovered that our condo dues had stopped automatically coming out. For 4 months we were never notified that we were not paying our condo dues! That is very alarming as a property owner when those dues are important to maintaining a reserve fund. Then, when I identified the problem, Windermere did not apologize at all for the issue and I had difficulty getting any one to call/email me back to try to rectify this issue. I could go on and on and I've only had Windermere managing my condo association for less than 6 months! The most recent issue is that we were served a random letter about needing a new water heater because it was over 10 years old. Now I can't get a call back about that! If you are paying money to have your property managed, find a different company. I am sorry to say you will be disappointed with Windermere. We are going to sell our condo now instead of dealing with the terrible customer service and problems with this property management company.

google_reviews.author: Stephen Matthes
google_reviews.review: Tonya was the absolute best property manager I have ever had. She always called me back right away and was on top of things. Very friendly, helpful and always assisted me with any issues I had at my apartment. I highly recommend Windermere property management if you are looking to rent. Frank as well was always friendly when I came into pay for my rent. Over all I would would give them 5 stars without a doubt. Thank you Tonya, frank and Windermere property management!!

google_reviews.author: Mason Cone
google_reviews.review: If you can absolutely help it, do not lease from Windermere! You should exhaust every other option before settling with them. And absolutely DO NOT LEASE AN APARTMENT AT 2300 DOUGLAS. These apartments are outrageously expensive, and the quality of them is terrible at best. There is absolutely no sunlight filtering in through the apartment, you have to pay an absurd amount to use a washer and dryer that are literally the size of a microwave, and because they dont replace the carpet or repaint it always smells dirty and musky. The first time we saw Bethany, the landlord, was on our move out day. She has since tried to take almost all of the security deposit for things missing, which are absolutely present and in the unit (albeit, they are not great quality, but it is what they left for us at the start of the lease. Replacement should thus come out of THEIR pocket, not ours). $250 to replace a door knob, Bethany? Please girl. We have called and emailed to ask questions and clarify, and have not received any response at all. If at all possible, let me reiterate: seek other options. You will save your money, save your time, and very likely wont stress out this much. I promise you there are better living situations in Bellingham than anything Windermere Property Management has to offer.

owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback. Your concerns are important to us and we value our customers. Please contact our office so we can address your experience directly.

google_reviews.author: Kerstin Martin
google_reviews.review: Worst customer service. Windermere property management made a mistake and listed our condo for rent on Zillow, but our condo has never been for rent and we never worked with Windermere. They manage our neighbors condo and probably used the wrong unit number by mistake. When I called them to ask them to please remove the rental listing from our Zillow profile the lady got very rude and said that they got hacked last month and this was not her problem and hung up on me. Certainly not a company Id ever use if I wanted to rent out my condo.

google_reviews.author: Travis Priest
google_reviews.review:
