They are a middle man company 100% in it for the money. Dealing directly with landlord would be and was more effective and better service. We had to pay a double deposit to move in to our place and half of that was taken away after moving out. The paint job was spotty when we moved in and was in same condition upon moving out but they charged us to repaint. The entire experience was more work than it was worth. I recommend avoiding working with this company unless absolutely desperate. I 100% believe they overcharged for every single thing including utilities that "had" to be billed through them and couldn't come directly to me. There responses to questions or issues were slow and incomplete or just non existent. The property listing was inaccurate stating "pets possible" which was one of the reasons we chose the property and after moving in were told no pets when all the neighbors had pets. I will definitely never work with any windermere branch or affiliation again because of this experience. The property manager was never of any help and out of office everytime we tried to contact. Don't let the front desk kindness fool you into believing that the company is the same way, they are not.

Listen to the other 1 star reviews I believe they are just as accurate as mine.

google_reviews.author: Martin Valentino
google_reviews.review: I paid a nonrefundable $45 to view an apartment and was never scheduled for a showing. They make you pay for a showing. I am renting thru Windermere & I paid a double deposit to rent, yet I cannot rent any other properties from them with a cosigner or with my double deposit. That makes no sense? I can afford my rent and I always pay. It's discrimination. They heavily discriminate and don't care about if you need a safe place to live!!!!

owner_response.text:
Hi Martin,
Our system does not show you are a tenant, applicant, or prospect with us at the Bellingham office. Please contact us so that we may work this out.
Thank you,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Noah Rawls
google_reviews.review: I recently rented from Windermere and was really pleased with the staff. Madison Sterk was easy to work with as she was very responsive and professional.

owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review!

Kind Regards,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Hannah Dunn
google_reviews.review:
Windermere has very poor management, and randomly expected all tenants to pay $7000 grand during the worse time of the pandemic. This has caused many to sell their homes and move elsewhere.

During meetings, they do not listen to others and are rude. Management poorly tracks their budget, and tenants get punished with large bills. Such as the roof payment.

Currently, there is a military personnel that takes pictures of others to report back to windermere, he has also been seen go into homes.

We have request simple repairs, and they still have not gotten back to us in months, management will only take care of things that get them more money.

Kathy, and her group bully among others, they have build up a negative reputation within our condo complex, and other apartments.

This association lacks many qualities.

google_reviews.author: Jaspreet Singh Sethi
google_reviews.review: I have been renting from Windermere for a while now and they have been great!! They are responsive to work orders and always friendly and helpful. Definitely would recommend renting with Windermere!

owner_response.text:
Thank you for the review and being our tenant!

Kind Regards,
Windermere Property Management

google_reviews.author: Glittery Fab
google_reviews.review:
Windemere came in and took over when our complex was sold this spring. We had Son-Rise who I wish we still had. Windermere does not respond to emails, concerns, and failed to change the trash pick up to their name (our lease has WSG included). We went several days with no garbage pickupand thats the tip of the iceberg. They do not follow ADA or fair housing act laws. It took me asking people on Reddit for advice for them to install a handicap spot. Now that that has been done, they ignored my requests for a second spot when I realized my neighbor has a disability as well. Sandi Jones is my PM and she offered me $200 to move out this summer when we had MOLD in our bathroom because she claimed they couldnt find a maintainence guy to fix the floor that was torn up by another! Incompetent and a liar!

To top this off, I was told to contact the police of people park illegally in the handicap spot. This happened a few times and the police said, private property - it is Windermeres responsibility. If I fall, Im suing Windermere and I told them I would.

It isnt just that, but several stairs are crumbling. My upstairs neighbor fell through the bottom ones years ago, and Windemere and the new owner know they need to be replaced and nothing has been done. The health department and city of Ferndale cant do anything either. Someone is going to get seriously hurt or worse, and all Windermere does is ignore emails. ESPECIALLY Sandi! Here is a picture of my upstairs neighbors staircase, which still hasnt been fixed!

google_reviews.author: Laney bell
google_reviews.review: Computers set up, to look at properties in the lobby.  Easy key check out to view property rentals.  Highly recommend.

google_reviews.author: Keaton Martin
google_reviews.review: Property managers are unaware of any contractor activity inside units and buildings, have horrendous response times, and poor-to-terrible customer service. Office personnel and professionalism are much better, but can't help with real problems. Renovations are somehow downgrades; I had four heating units, now I have three. This is after 6 months of 'work' that left huge holes in my walls. The property manager was not concerned when I brought it up.

owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback, your concerns are important to us and we value our customer service. Please contact our office so we can address your experience directly.

google_reviews.author: Finn Mize
google_reviews.review:
Windermere is so helpful with information and the like. if you CALL they try to help. Getting keys is pretty easy as well. HOWEVER...

Their apartments are hard to appreciate since they let you go by before the renovations are done. I found a human tooth in the apartment I went to tour.

THAT IS SO FREAKY!!!

The second tour I went was in the middle of being ripped apart, covered in smoke, dirk, and musk even on the top floor of the building.

While the staff is nice, the complexes are TERRIBLE not to mention the  cost of laundry on site (which I checked was 4$ (wash and dry) a load, ...Imagine if you had to do sheets and whatnot In the same week!!! EXPENSIVE!).
(AKA 4 weeks a month... That means  Add that to your rent costs!!!) So, if you washed clothes you will end up at 160 alone.

Towels or bedding will add a load or two a week! It is to expensive.

google_reviews.author: A. G.
google_reviews.review:
Make sure you take pictures before and as you leave your rental place with Windermere Property Management.

I was an unfortunate tenant renting in one of their duplexes. We made the mistake of being too confident in how nice we left the place that when we moved out that we didn't take any photos and got charged outrageously for things that didn't make sense or exist.

When we first moved in, there was holes in window screens, a glue stain on the wall or something from putting carpet down (we assume that's what it is, we've tried washing it but it didn't come out with cleaner) when we first moved in. These things we pointed out when we noticed, along with a broken handle on the microwave but was shrugged off because it personally didn't bother us. There was also things already existing on the property. The garage was full of home maintenance materials, such as wood, paint, and other things. There was a shed full of miscellaneous things that looked to be there for years that we were told belonged to the home owner so we didn't touch it.
Now we're getting charged for these things, as well as the glue on the wall being blamed on our pet.

We made sure this place was spotless and we only lived in it a year with very little use. There was a scrape on the wall from our chair and that was it. But somehow we're getting charged OVER our deposit amount. Over things like lightbulbs and other ridiculous things! We unfortunately didn't take photos, they didn't even give us a walk around to ok things either.

After we had moved out they told us some time into the next month for the first time that if we didn't hand over the keys they'd charge us another month's rent. We never had this before because locks are usually replaced by home owners making the keys useless (beware on that also if you plan on renting from them).
We were moved up into Canada at the time but luckily we had to do one last run into the states to cover bases so we were able to return the keys in time.

We have never had issues with any of the rental properties we've lived in. We always got full or 90% of our deposit back. We always have had shining reviews with our landlords. We pride ourselves as good tenants.
If you plan on renting from Windermere, be prepared to be swindled out of every penny they can manage to get out of you. I'm seeing many reviews with the same issues we're having with Windermere word for word practically. They're known for this, I would avoid at all costs.

google_reviews.author: Frances Dillinger
google_reviews.review: Listen to the one star reviews !! This place does not care about their tenants.  I lived in a building with windows as old as the building and paid way more for heat in the winter than I should have and they kept saying they were going to eventually replace the windows.  Never did.  The carpet had multiple stains and burns on it and they refused to replace it or clean it properly when I moved it, after paying rent on time , and what did they do after ? Charge me to clean the carpets when they should have replaced them. Moldy and gross should have read the reviews here before moving in.   Greedy corporate pigs

owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback. Your concerns are important to us and we value our customers. Please contact our office so we can address your experience directly.

google_reviews.author: Aimee C.
google_reviews.review:
We had a good experience with Windermere. We received our security deposit back and they always answered our questions/concerns. The property we rented was very nice and we could pay our rent online.
I'd heard a lot of horror stories about property management companies in Bellingham. We even had the displeasure of another property management company we'd communicated with online and over the phone try to pressure us into signing a lease for an unseen one-bedroom apartment after initially lying to us about it being two-bedrooms -- knowing we'd have limited options after we moved across the state. Luckily, Windermere was there to help us out and got us into a townhome by the end of the week. If we ever moved back to Whatcom County, I'd definitely use Windermere again. Matter of fact, knowing what I know now and the scary stories I've heard from locals, I'd' ONLY use Windermere.

google_reviews.author: Jeremiah Franks
google_reviews.review: Worst ran company I've ever experienced. I would be ashamed to be apart of it. Just terrible experiences trying to get application through then finally got approved after talking with lead manager. Told to use online portal for maintenance etc. Used portal when I had a leaking toilet. No response after several days. Try calling but no one will answer. Called from parking lot and could see front desk ladies painting finger nails. Property manager's voicemail says "Do not leave me a message...."  He will only respond with sarcastic and disrespectful emails. Tried to pay rent with cash but front desk states that only certain people can and since I haven't paid with cash before I could not. Property manager says they are not a bank so they don't take cash....But it's a business!

owner_response.text: We appreciate your feedback and would like to address your concern. Customer satisfaction is important to us. Please contact our office to handle your complaint. Thank you

google_reviews.author: Hannah Tanha
google_reviews.review:
Just had the WORST experience. I am a renter of the same condo for over two years and never missed a payment. They have all of mine and my husband's contact info on file. The only way we use to enter our condo is through the garage and never use the front door. Apparently Windermere posted four days ago on our front door that they would be entering our home for an annual inspection (which they didn't do last year, might I add) between a 7 hour time frame. This was the only notice we were given that it was to happen today, so when my husband found it taped to the INSIDE of our front door when he got home from the store today he was livid. He called Windermere to see why they hadn't tried to call or email, but got nothing but excuses.

This wouldn't upset me so much if I was not working a night shift tonight and ASLEEP UPSTAIRS while complete strangers were in my house. I didn't hear anything, but I feel so extremely violated.

If I could, I would leave you no stars for this.

DO BETTER, WINDERMERE.

google_reviews.author: Inoo Jun
google_reviews.review:
Moved in with three adult family members. House was brand new (still getting finished when we signed the lease, couldn't move in for a week) but had mud under the stove, scuffs throughout the house, ect...

A year later (no longer on lease, but month to month) we get a notice saying that they were upping the rent by $50. The letters were sent out on the 7th, the last day in which a tenant can inform them that they intended to move without paying for the next month. We informed them on the 15th. Given when we moved in, this was our last day to inform them that we were leaving. Everything was going fine until they said we had to pay for the next month. We called them out on the date of the letters. We also informed them about how we were not allowed to move in for a week despite already paying (we received not back pay for this week either). We also consulted a lawyer on this, who said they were in the wrong.

A few weeks passed, we moved into another place, everything seemed fine. That is, until they sent us an email saying we owed them $500!! They were charging us for the following month's rent, professional carpet, and house cleaning. The house was completely spotless when we returned it, there were no holes in the walls, and there was nothing in the lease about professional house cleaning, only carpet. That place probably looked better than when we moved in.

We should have sued them. Never, NEVER again!! Beware because if all of the Windermere offices are as shady as these guys, you'll get worked over BIG TIME.

google_reviews.author: harlow friday
google_reviews.review: Absolutely horrible. I had a year-long lease and contract with them, when they decided to cancel our contract effective immediately, after we became aware that all parties hadn't signed the lease agreement and there was a cat with claws living at the house contrary to their policy. They failed to return all tenant paperwork as well as the property keys, after multiple requests. It is important to know Ebright Wight Maintenance Is a wholly owned subsidiary of Windemere property management by Ebright white LLC and as a licensed general contractor that provides maintenance service to Windemeer management clients.

google_reviews.author: Alex kuksenko
google_reviews.review: We moved around a lot. This is the first time I actually have to rate my experience. We moved into a new unit they built. Place was still settling and a few cracks developed. They charged us for that. Then when I tried to dispute it, they sent me to their slowest person ever and instead of listening, he kept going on and on, on how he is green and fair. They robbed is from our money. Recommend to not do business with them.

owner_response.text: We would love to hear you feedback and directly assist you. We value our clients and your experience with us. Please contact our office regarding your complaint.

google_reviews.author: Jackson Holt
google_reviews.review: Not once, not twice, but on THREE SEPARATE OCCASIONS NOW, we've parked in the windermere parking lot, and all of three times somebody has been tampering with our vehicles. Mine was broken into twice, and my friend literally had their WHEEL taken right off the car. We thought we would be okay because windermere has security cameras monitoring those spots--but every time we've contacted them about it they have been entirely unresponsive. DO. NOT. GIVE. THESE. PEOPLE. YOUR. BUSINESS. If they can't be held responsible to keep their own property in check, what business do you think they have telling you about YOURS?

google_reviews.author: Lori P
google_reviews.review: Sandy from Windermere Property Management set up an appointment to come to view my rental unit in the Columbia neighbourhood.  Very unfortunate that she was a 'no show' and when I called her office I was told she was running late for a meeting.  However, I received no call back, no follow up, no apology for my inconvenience and I still don't know what happened. I guess, assuming this is an indication of how they do business, I potentially avoided major problems in the future.  Just saying'.

google_reviews.author: danielle (d505)
google_reviews.review: They raised my rent 64% over the last 3 years. I started out paying $1600 in 2018 and as of Sept 1 2021 it will be $2500, plus $150 for w/s/g. This last raise was $650, during a global pandemic and during a housing bottleneck. Purely money driven. They also haven't responded to requests I made for repairs 2 months ago. Not sure why I would pay a $650 more a month when they won't even do $20 repairs.

google_reviews.author: Dana Sanders
google_reviews.review:
I was a senior at WWU when I leased through Windermere.  My roommate and I had a 3 bedroom unit that was fairly old and worn (which is expected for a college town) but nothing was too broken or had any major problems.

Any maintenance issue that came up I would notify them on the online website and someone would come out fairly quickly to fix the problem.  When I moved out there were some complications regarding previous damages to the unit from the tenants before us but the management was respectful and were able to quickly resolve the problems.  I would just suggest (as for anyone looking to lease anything) to be very specific on your move-in inspections when noting any previous damages as to not have any problems when moving out!

Overall, don't expect the units to be perfect in a college town, but if you pay your bills and are responsible tenants, everything will be just fine.  I've definitely had worse managements than Windermere.  I would pick Windermere over any other leasing management in Bellingham.

google_reviews.author: Daman Thomas Caldwell, Authorized Representative
google_reviews.review:
Do not rent or do business with these people. Property manager is constantly out of the office and never gets back with you. Maintenance is told tenants are too needy when it comes to fixing anything. When they do "attempt" to fix something,it's done incorrectly.
We've rented from them for two years and have seen the property manager here twice. If you see something wrong and speak out against it, the violators complain and you get a notice on your door. Interesting. It's a good thing I'm smart enough to document and record EVERYTHING. Cover your butts folks,we live in a soft society where elephants in rooms are now decorative.

google_reviews.author: zac BEYER
google_reviews.review: Windermere property management wow! I won't say names but the property manager could care less about me or the property. She ignores emails and maintenance concerns, it took 4 weeks to get my ceiling fan fixed, last time I checked it was supposed to be done within 10 days. There is black mold that she is ignoring throughout the building, not to mention other  problems. I hope this company can get there sh.. together and maybe upper management will get rid of the property manager!

google_reviews.author: Lyndee Sheehan
google_reviews.review: I've never dealt with such an unprofessional property management company in my life. I'm surprised their rating isn't lower.  I moved out of their rental 6 weeks ago and am still waiting for my security deposit back. Everytime I talk to them, there is an excuse.  They're breaking the law, and it's incredibly frustrating. I see small claims court in my future...

owner_response.text: We value our tenants and want you to have a good experience working with us. Please contact our office so that we can address your situation. Thank you

google_reviews.author: Ian Campbell
google_reviews.review:
My best friend's family and I rented from Windermere for the duration of a ten month lease that just ended, and I have never had such a positive experience with a property management company. Bethany in particular has been extremely kind and helpful! Where should I begin?

Well, first, before we even signed the lease, there was an issue that arose from us applying to a property the owner of which didn't want rented to students. We all somehow overlooked this on its listing, and since I was just starting graduate school I declared that I was a student on my application. We were initially denied the property, but I felt that "students" wasn't intended to mean graduate students in their mid 20s, so I wrote them a letter explaining that I understood they need to respect the property owner's stipulations and asked if my appeal and the explanation of the circumstances could be forwarded to you owner. Bethany responded to my email and was was very nice and understanding. She explained the situation to the owner, and we ended up getting the house! Yay!

While we lived there, they were really good about giving us notices of entry on time, and they didn't micromanage the property we rented at all--not even after they came in for an annual inspection, or when our lawn mower broke and our yard was a jungle for a few weeks while we Craiglisted around for a new one. No guff was given, it was really pleasant to rent from them. I've had many landlords that breathe down tenants' necks. I remember once, when I was a kid growing up in Montana, my family rented from someone who insisted that we shovel the walkway WHILE it was snowing. In Montana! I don't remember if it was an individual or a property manager, but the moral of this story is that landlords can be absolutely crazy.

I think we were even late on our rent once, and I don't believe they dinged us for it.

But moving out this past week has been where Windermere has really shown me how accommodating they can be if you're nice about things. June rolled around, and we got notice that the house wasn't going to be re-rented after our lease expired, so we had to find a new place--fast. We found a place that became available on or a few days after the first of July, so there was going to be a day or two (or three) period where we didn't have a house. We were fine with this, but the problem was that we have four tropical fishtanks that need to be plugged in all the time. It looked like we had two options: move the fish tanks to the middle of a very generous friend's living room or garage, only to move them once more after a few days (which would stress the fish out twice as much as a normal move would, and would SUCK SO BAD since these are large tanks and all have live plants), or see if Windermere will allow us to keep them on the property after we were supposed to be totally out. Bethany again understood our situation and we were able to just leave the tanks there for a week after they could have legally disposed of them. This took a LOT of stress off of our shoulders. I really appreciated all this flexibility and reasonableness, and if I find myself renting in Bellingham again, I'll be sure to check Windermere's listings first. Thanks for working with us like you have!

owner_response.text: While we at Windermere Management empathize with your situation, we are unable to pay you the unfounded small claims action that you filed against us. The judge clearly informed you that there was no basis for your claims of theft from your apartment home and your storage unit or for the condition of the apartment home when you returned your keys. The home needed paint, hauling, cleaning, repairs of a wall heater and towel bar as well as carpet cleaning. You were provided photos in court as to the documented condition of the home. You were also carrying a past due balance on your account going into the reconciliation process. Since we do not manage the storage unit where other theft was reported, we cannot speak to that situation. We offered to re-key your unit when we were informed by you of the alleged theft, and you opted to have it done. According to you the theft continued. We have no control should you leave your doors or windows unsecured. We advised that you should call the police and provide them with dates, times and descriptions of the perpetrators. In court you said you called the police many times and they never responded. You did say also that you attempted to retrieve your lost items from a neighbor and were arrested. Our hope is that you are able to retrieve your personal effects and that you can move forward.

summary.text:
Good

Windermere Management by Ebright Wight has had its share of commendations, particularly related to individual staff members and responsive service in certain cases. Some tenants have praised specific employees like Tonya and Nicole for being prompt, helpful, and treating them with respect and professionalism. For example, a renter was pleased with Tonya’s assistance during their lease and demonstrated a willingness to go above and beyond for clients, providing quick maintenance responses and effective communication. Additionally, some landlords have reported satisfaction with how the company manages their properties, ensuring timely inspections, and providing quality tenant placement. Another landlord mentioned positive experiences over a decade, crediting their assigned agent with managing a complete rebuild process efficiently after significant property damage.

In other reviews, clients have highlighted the materials provided by Windermere, claiming the properties are managed well in some scenarios. Renters have shared that maintenance issues, when addressed, are resolved swiftly, resulting in renewed satisfaction for tenants who initially faced difficulties. The company’s ability to foster positive relationships is shown as some tenants reported feeling valued and treated like family, with several expressing gratitude for seamless move-ins and stress-free interactions during their stay. The presence of friendly and supportive front desk staff further reinforces the positive remarks, making certain interactions with Windermere Management a pleasure for multiple tenants and landlords alike.

Great

Windermere Management shines in its ability to build strong tenant and landlord relationships through dedicated team members who deliver excellent service experiences. Many reviews consistently highlight the company's proficiency in handling maintenance promptly, with mentions of exceptional staff members like Cody repairing properties efficiently and with positive attitudes. These instances suggest Windermere's commitment to tenant satisfaction. Moreover, the company’s effort to assist tenants navigating particular challenges, such as sourcing a new refrigerator during a critical period, underscores the responsibility and empathy shown by select employees. This level of service fosters trust and loyalty, making clients feel appreciated and attended to throughout their renting journey.

There are instances where Windermere has gone beyond basic property management duties, helping landlords navigate complicated scenarios smoothly. For example, Windermere staff assisted a landlord with a damaged property, providing insightful support and consistent follow-up during a three-month reconstruction period. Despite the market’s high demand and the complexity of tenant placement, specific agents have distinguished themselves by finding suitable tenants promptly, garnering appreciation from landlords. Furthermore, renters praised Nicole for her attentiveness, creating a seamless rental experience that was both accommodating and rewarding. Overall, these experiences indicate that when Windermere's team excels, tenants and landlords alike are left with a deep sense of satisfaction and peace of mind.

Bad

Despite some positive feedback, Windermere Management has faced criticism about inconsistency and communication issues. Clients have reported frustrations over prolonged response times, with many former tenants highlighting significant delays in addressing maintenance requests. A common complaint is that property issues such as mold, faulty appliances, and needed repairs linger for weeks or even months before receiving attention. Renters often found themselves having to follow up multiple times before any action was taken, undermining their confidence in the management's efficiency. Furthermore, the company's communication practices also seem to falter in billing and rental processes. Customers have expressed dissatisfaction with being charged for issues not of their making, such as pre-existing property damage that was dismissed during the move-in but later billed upon move-out.

Negative experiences extend to the application process and contractual dealings, which a number of users found lacking in transparency. Tenants and applicants have voiced grievances about being misled during the application phase, with scenarios where their applications were rejected after costly submissions without clear explanations. There are claims of discrimination and lack of courtesy, particularly concerning rental qualifying criteria and customers being inadequately informed about the status of their applications. Renters have shared accounts of abrupt deposit deductions with minimal justification and have also perceived discrepancies in lease agreements, leading to unexpected charges and disputes that the management did not resolve satisfactorily. These issues have resulted in negative perceptions among many clients who feel undermined by Windermere’s operational inconsistencies.

Ugly

Windermere Management's approach reportedly escalates to egregious levels of dissatisfaction among some renters and landlords, leading to accusations of unethical business practices. Many reviews cite instances of the management's dismissiveness towards tenant rights and severe lapses in service that contribute to hostile living environments. Examples include severe maintenance issues that pose health hazards, such as untreated black mold and unsafe structural conditions within rented units. In a striking case, a tenant continued facing administrative oversight and inadequate response to a reported mold problem, leading to significant personal distress and health concerns. Other experiences involve allegations of predatory practices, such as withholding security deposits without valid justification or charging exorbitant fees for minor repairs.

Particularly disturbing accounts delve into alleged discriminatory behaviors during the rental application process, describing the property management as uncooperative and unaccommodating toward specific demographic groups. Spiraling hostilities between management and tenants are underscored by complaints of verbal abuse from staff, a lack of follow-through on maintenance disputes, and frequent rental increases during financially trying times. Furthermore, property owners have shared their distress over mismanaged properties and recurrent unauthorized entries, leaving them unable to rely on Windermere for adequate property care. These severe criticisms paint a challenging picture of a company struggling with transparency and accountability, with numerous clients advising potential tenants and landlords to choose alternative property management services to avoid similar detrimental experiences.
